messages.title: Bronglais extension survives ConDem cuts
messages.content: £38 million in funding for the much needed front-of-house extension to Bronglais Hospital has been confirmed by the Welsh Government, despite the ConDem government's swinging public spending cuts.

messages.title: New Aberystwyth library
messages.content: Local residents are looking forward to seeing Aberystwyth's town library opening at the Town Hall once refurbishment of the vacant building is completed.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Elin Jones has secured funding for Bronglais Hospital's extension and fights to prevent potential downgrades to local hospital services.
Plaid Cymru pledges to create 50,000 new jobs through measures such as a £500m infrastructure fund and a focus on moving to a 90% economy.

Elin Jones is committed to improving green travel within Ceredigion, and supports sustainable travel projects like better park and ride services, a cycle path from Penrhyn-coch to Aberystwyth, and electric buses.

issues.economy: Plaid Cymru aims to create jobs and help small businesses grow. An economy moving to a 90% fund for business tax relief is also proposed.
issues.environment: Plaid Cymru has secured funding for sustainable travel projects in Aberystwyth, including a cycle path from Penrhyn-coch to Aberystwyth and electric buses.
issues.health: Elin Jones has worked to secure funding for Bronglais Hospital to ensure it gets the necessary extension it needs, despite cuts from the ConDem government.

housing.content: A new Aberystwyth town library is set to open in the Town Hall, offering improved service and better accessibility for all residents.

politicalExperience.achievements: Elin Jones has reportedly secured a £38 million funding for Bronglais Hospital's extension and prevented downgrades to hospital services. She also played a key role in relocating Aberystwyth's town library to benefit the local community.

images.caption: Elin Jones & Plaid Cymru - Best for Ceredigion
